div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: What is stress? Stress is defined by the Oxford dictionary as: "a state of mental or emotional strain or tension resulting from adverse or very demanding circumstances"
1. Explore Coping Mechanisms: find what YOUR coping mechanisms are that calm your stressors

li.p: Exercise, Reading a Book, Walks, Meditation are all forms of coping mechanisms

div.p: 2. Keep a Routine: It is important to keep your routine as regular as possible during this time

li.p: Keep your usual "waking and bed times" & keep it consistent
Keep your typical readiness routine in the morning
Keep your usual "breaks" that you would typically take & require yourself to do so
Keep your typical meal routine
Set short/long term goals: It is important to have a vision. Setting short and long term goals will allow you to work in "chunks of time" that work best with the schedule you need to establish
Short term goals- Daily goals (by class)
Long term goals- Weekly goals (by class)
Prioritize your goals
Manage your time on a daily basis
Create a google calendar or something similar to establish a schedule you will stick to, including daily breaks

span.strong: 4. Know That It's OK to be stressed

li.p: Often times, people find themselves stressed because they feel that they "can't" or "shouldn't" feel stressed.
Stress is a normal response/reaction
If you feel you are checking social media or television too often, know that it's OK to be seeking information
Seeking information can lessen your stress
Allow time in your day to "check-in" and then "check-out" of media outlets
At the end of your "school day," establish a routine as you would if you were leaving your school work space for the day
Spending time with your family is important
Spending time with your pet is important
If you are living alone, allow yourself to communicate with friends and family in a different fashion (FaceTime, Zoom, Google Hangouts)

em.strong: If you feel overly stressed or anxious for a prolonged period of time (2 or more week) please seek help from a professional

li.p: Contact your Primary Care Physician or call the Health Partners Telehealth line
Remember that YOU ARE IMPORTANT

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

li.p: Establish normal wake and bed times
Limit device use outside of the work day
Establish daily work hours/times and stick to them
Create a Google Calendar or something similar
Establish or remain consistent with your meals/snacking times
Ensure that you have enough space to work effectively
Ensure that you have a quiet space
If you're setting up in a bedroom, be sure to setup a work area that is not on a bed
Working/sitting on a bed can cause nighttime anxiety
Ensure that you have breaks during your day to allow your mind and body time to refresh and refocus
Try your best to work in a space that you can shut a door to or turn away from as you end your "school day"
This is good, mindful practice to prepare your body/mind that your school day is complete

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-wNfPc pSzOP-AhqUyc-wNfPc jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque

div.jsaction: touchstart:UrsOsc; click:KjsqPd; focusout:QZoaZ; mouseover:y0pDld; mouseout:dq0hvd;fv1Rjc:jbFSOd;CrfLRd:SzACGe;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

li.p: Try to avoid "junk" food as much as possible. Too much sugar in your day can inhibit attention-span and can also decrease the amount of good vitamins stored in your body that keep your mind and body healthy.
Eat the rainbow! Ensure that you are eating from all of the food groups that are describes below.
The School Meal Program is a great way to receive nutritional meals during the week while we navigate through this time

p.em: The Google Form to sign-up for the Government Meal Program is here:

div.p: The website below is ran by SPARK in Ashland County. It will be updated with new activities daily and will include approximately 4-6 self-contained, fun and relatively quick activities each day in the categories of:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.strong: ***If you or a loved one are experiencing prolonged periods of stress, anxiety or depression: Please contact your primary care provider or a mental health professional listed below:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Bad River Health and Wellness Center - (715) 682-7133 - they are still taking calls for mental health and substance use services -- all calls will be triaged by a nurse and assigned for services.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: NorthLakes Community Clinic: (888)-834-4551 -- they can speak with you via phone or tele-health and are doing new intakes currently via tele-health.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Northland Counseling: (715) 682-2141 - crisis bed services still available for adults and will see youth for crisis assessments (though the youth crisis bed is currently closed.) They are doing intakes for new clients (adults and youth) for outpatient counseling -- intake appointment is in person with tele-health continuing appointments.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: MMC - Behavioral Health Services - (715) 685-5400 - still seeing already established clients via tele-health.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
